resources.string: \ The Devil\'s Dictionary started in a weekly paper in 1881 by Ambrose Bierce. The book offers reinterpretations of terms in the English language, lampooning empty, uncritical thought or talk and political doublespeak, as well as other aspects of human foolishness and frailty. \n\nThis version of the dictionary was implemented by John Selmys at Seneca College in Toronto - 2011.
